H0.text: The rotation of the solar system makes the Sun and Moon seem to move across the sky.

H1.text: The rotation of Earth makes the Sun and Moon seem to move across the sky.

H2.text: The Sun and Moon revolve around Earth, which causes them to appear to move across the sky.

H3.text: Earth revolves around the Sun and the Moon is why the Sun and Moon appear to move across the sky.

A4.text: In 499 CE, the Indian astronomer Aryabhata suggested that the spherical Earth rotates about its axis daily and that the apparent movement of the stars is a relative motion caused by the rotation of the Earth.

A5.text: According to al‑Biruni, al‑Sijzi ... 'that the motion we see is due to the Earth's movement and not to that of the sky.'
